workflow.name: Multi-platform source discovery with SerpAPI, DuckDuckGo, GitHub, Reddit & Bluesky
workflow.description:
# Source Discovery - Automatically Search More Up-to-Date Information Sources

## ðŸŽ¬ Overview
**Version** : 1.0

This workflow utilizes various nodes to discover and analyze potential sources of information from platforms like Google, Reddit, GitHub, Bluesky, and others. It is designed to streamline the process of finding relevant sources based on specified search themes.

## âœ¨ Features

- Automated source discovery from multiple platforms.
- Filtering of existing and undesired sources.
- Error handling for API requests.
- User-friendly configuration options.

## ðŸ‘¤ Who is this for?

This workflow is ideal for researchers, content marketers, journalists, and anyone looking to efficiently gather and analyze information from various online sources.

## ðŸ’¡ What problem does this solve?

This workflow addresses the challenge of manually searching for relevant information sources, saving time and effort while ensuring that users have access to the most pertinent content. Ideal use-cases include:

- Resource Compilation for Academic and Educational Purposes
- Journalism and Research
- Content Marketing
- Competitor Analysis

## ðŸ” What this workflow does

The workflow gathers data from selected platforms through search terms. It filters out known and undesired sources, analyzes the content, and provides insights into potential sources relevant to the user's needs.

## ðŸ”„ Workflow Steps

### 1. Search Queries

- Fetch sources using SerpAPI search, DuckDuckGo, and Bluesky.
- Utilizes GitHub repositories to find relevant links.
- Leverages RSS feeds from subreddits to identify potential sources.

### 2. Filtering Step

- Removes existing and undesired sources from the results.

### 3. Source Selection

- Analyzes the content of the identified sources for relevance.

## ðŸ“Œ Expected Input / Configuration

The workflow is primarily configured via the **Configure Workflow Args (Manual)** node or the **Global Variables** custom node.

- Search themes: Keywords or phrases relevant to the desired content.
- Lists of known sources and undesired sources for filtering.


## ðŸ“¦ Expected Output

A curated list of potential sources relevant to the specified search themes, along with insights into their content.

## ðŸ“Œ Example

![printscreen1.png](fileId:1965)

![printscreen2.png](fileId:1964)

![printscreen3.png](fileId:1961)

![printscreen4.png](fileId:1962)

![printscreen5.png](fileId:1963)

![printscreen6.png](fileId:1966)

## âš™ï¸ n8n Setup Used

- **n8n version:** 1.105.3
- **n8n-nodes-serpapi:** 0.1.6
- **n8n-nodes-globals:** 1.1.0
- **n8n-nodes-bluesky-enhanced**: 1.6.0
- **n8n-nodes-duckduckgo-search**: 30.0.4
- **LLM Model:** mistral-small-latest (API)
- **Platform:** Podman 4.3.1 on Linux
- **Date:** 2025-08-06

## âš¡ Requirements to Use / Setup

- Self-hosted or cloud n8n instance.
- Install the following custom nodes: SerpAPI, Bluesky, and DuckDuckGo Search.
    - [n8n-nodes-serpapi](https://github.com/serpapi/n8n-nodes-serpapi)
    - [n8n-nodes-duckduckgo-search](https://github.com/samnodehi/n8n-nodes-duckduckgo)
    - [n8n-nodes-bluesky-enhanced](https://github.com/brianmoney/n8n-nodes-bluesky)
- Install the Global Variables Node for enhanced configuration:
	- [n8n-nodes-globals](https://github.com/umanamente/n8n-nodes-globals) (or use Edit Field (Set) node instead)
- Provide valid credentials to nodes for your preferred LLM model, SerpAPI, and Bluesky. Credentials for GitHub recommended.

## âš ï¸ Notes, Assumptions \& Warnings

- Ensure compliance with the terms of service of any platforms accessed or discovered in this workflow, particularly concerning data usage and attribution.
- Monitor API usage to avoid hitting rate limits.
- The workflow may encounter errors such as 403 responses; in such cases, it will continue by ignoring the affected substep.
- Duplicate removal is applied, but occasional overlaps might still appear depending on the sources.
- This workflow assumes familiarity with n8n, APIs, and search engines.
- Using AI agents (Mistral or substitute LLMs) requires access to their API services and keys.
- This is not a *Curator of News*. It is designed to find websites that are relevant and useful to your searches. If you are looking for a relevant news selector, please check this [workflow](https://n8n.io/workflows/6157-multi-source-news-curator-with-mistral-ai-analysis-summaries-and-custom-channels/).

## â„¹ï¸ About Us

This workflow was developed by the Hybroht team. Our goal is to create tools that harness the possibilities of technology and more. We aim to continuously improve and expand functionalities based on community feedback and evolving use cases. For questions, reach out via [contact@hybroht.com](mailto:contact@hybroht.com).


---

### âš–ï¸ Warranty & Legal Notice

This free workflow is provided "as-is" without any warranties of any kind, either express or implied, including but not limited to the implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, or non-infringement.

By using this workflow, you acknowledge that you do so at your own risk. We shall not be held responsible for any damages, losses, or liabilities arising from the use or inability to use this workflow, including but not limited to any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages.

It is your responsibility to ensure that your use of this workflow complies with all applicable laws and regulations.

---

workflow.name: Source Discovery - Automatically Search More Up-to-Date Information Sources

parameters.content:
## Search Queries with DuckDuckGo & Bluesky

This step utilizes the DuckDuckGo and Bluesky custom nodes to identify potential sources based on the specified search themes.

***Observations***:
- The Bluesky Node maximum results are configured to 10.
- DuckDuckGo's Safe Search is configured to "Strict."
- DuckDuckGo's maximum results are configured to 100.

## Search Queries with SerpAPI

This step utilizes the SerpAPI custom node to identify potential sources based on the specified search themes.

***Observations***:
- SerpAPI is configured to retrieve results from Google Search.

## Source Discovery - Automatically Search More Up-to-Date Information Sources



**Version** : 1.0
**Creator** : Hybroht
**Website** : hybroht.com
**Email**   : contact@hybroht.com






**Description**: Are you tired of the tedious process of searching for new information sources? This workflow streamlines the task of discovering new sources of content that may be relevant to your inquiries.

**How it Works**: The workflow searches for key terms across specific platforms to locate related URLs. It then cleans the data, checks against a list of known sources, verifies against a list of undesired sources, and performs a partial content check to assess relevance.

**Use Cases**:

- Resource Compilation for Academic and Educational Purposes
- Journalism and Research
- Content Marketing
- Competitor Analysis


**Requirements**:

- The following custom nodes must be installed: SerpApi, Bluesky, and DuckDuckGo Search.
- While the Global Variables Node is recommended, it is optional. You may use an Edit Fields (Set) Node as an alternative, named "Configure Workflow Args (Manual)" Node in this workflow.
- Credentials are required for Bluesky Search and SerpApi. Although the GitHub Repo Search does not require credentials, it is recommended to avoid rate limits.


**Observation:**

- This is not a *Curator of News*. It is designed to find websites that are relevant and useful to your searches. If you are looking for relevant news, please check this [workflow](https://n8n.io/workflows/6157-multi-source-news-curator-with-mistral-ai-analysis-summaries-and-custom-channels/).

parameters.content:
## Search Queries with Github (Repos with Links)

This step utilizes GitHub repositories to identify potential sources based on the specified search themes. Many repositories aggregate useful websites and list them in their READMEs, and we will leverage this pattern to our benefit. This workflow allows for quick checks of these links.

***Observations***
While credentials are not required, they are highly recommended. Without them, you will be subject to a strict rate limit.

nodes.name: Prepare Reddit RSS
nodes.notes: If you don't want to use the Global Variables Node, you can use this one as a replacement.

nodes.name: Get Base URL of Reddit Sources
Prepare Reddit Source Results
nodes.notes: If you don't want to use the Global Variables Node, you can use this one as a replacement.

parameters.content:
## Search Queries with Reddit

This step leverages RSS feeds from subreddits to identify potential sources relevant to the specified search themes.

***Observations***:
- Only the first subreddit returned will be considered, and the links mentioned in its posts will be treated as potential sources.
- If this step encounters a 403 error, the workflow will continue by ignoring this substep.

## Filtering Step for Existing and Undesired Sources

You likely have a few sources that you know and trust, as well as some that you may want to exclude. By adding them to the lists of known sources, this step will filter them out before they are sent for AI evaluation.

**Get Base URL** extracts the main website URL portion from the provided links. We aim for general website links rather than specific URLs, which is especially useful for identifying potential duplicates.

**Remove Existing Content** and **Remove Ignored Souces** are the primary filtering steps. These will compare the obtained URLs with those in the lists you provided, ensuring that any matches are removed.

nodes.name: HTTP Request to get URL Content
Get Base URL of Github Sources
Prepare Github Source Results
nodes.notes: If you don't want to use the Global Variables Node, you can use this one as a replacement.

parameters.content:
## Final Step: Source Selection

In this step, we will send the website content to an information extractor, which will evaluate the relevance and recency of the content concerning the specified search themes. While you can directly utilize the results, this step serves primarily to assist you in making informed decisions during your selection of the best sources. We recommend reviewing the results from the Information Extractor, as there may be valuable sources that it misclassifies as irrelevant, depending on your LLM model.

***Observations:***
- A limit node has been implemented to mitigate the risk of checking an excessive number of sources. You can adjust this limit if desired.
- Additionally, a Code node has been included to restrict the GET content due to context window limitations.
- This step is auxiliary in nature and may be prone to errors, such as the website blocking the GET method.

## Setup and Start

**Execute workflow** is a manual alternative method for using the workflow without the Global Variables Node.

**Schedule** is the standard method for operation. It will verify the credentials stored in the Global Variables Node for all necessary arguments.

parameters.text:
=Check this link: {{ $('Limit').item.json.baseUrl }}.
Check its content: """{{ $json.data }}"""

Follow the provided JSON schema for your response.

options.systemPromptTemplate:
You are an expert extraction algorithm.
Only extract relevant information from the text.
If you do not know the value of an attribute asked to extract, you may omit the attribute's value.

parameters.content:
**Configure Workflow Args**:

- search_themes: Utilized by this workflow to identify sources relevant to the specified themes.

- existing_sources: Employed by this workflow to filter out sources that are already known.

- sources_to_ignore: Used by this workflow to exclude undesired sources.

- rss_feeds: Applicable only in the Global Variables Node. This list can supplement the existing_sources list.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).
